intro: Melanthera richardsiae, commonly known as the Richards' melanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and clusters of small flowers. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, woolly hairs, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a prominent midrib. The flowers are small, greenish-white, and arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
